positive.review:
World of Tanks is a solid game to drop into when you have some time to kill, but it's not a must-play masterpiece.

The tank combat is genuinely engagingâ€”it has enough tactical depth with its armor angling and spotting mechanics to make you feel smart when you pull off a good play, and the enormous variety of historical tanks means there's always something new to unlock. The thrill of grinding up a tech tree and finally earning that coveted Tier X is a great feeling.

However, be warned that the experience is highly inconsistent. It's often frustrating due to seemingly random shot dispersion and shell non-penetrations, and the lengthy grind in the later tiers is clearly structured to encourage you to spend real money. If you can approach it casually, laugh off the losses, and just enjoy piloting those awesome tanks, you'll have fun. But if you're looking for the most competitive or best-balanced experience on Steam, this isn't it.
As an 11th-year vet this game improved a lot and waiting its release that remade the game in Unreal Engine 5.

Very grindy, only play this if your PC cant handle other versions of World of Tanks, really fun with friends, the platoon limit (self-organized team) is upsetting. As queueing with more than 3 friends would be terrific. I do have to mention, please be really careful what you buy here, it is a gacha game to an extent and its very easy to fall into a spending loophole. Only spend what you can afford to loose.

World of Tanks Blitz delivers an impressive mobile tank-combat experience with fast-paced battles, polished graphics, and surprisingly deep tactical gameplay. Despite being designed for shorter matches, the game retains the strategic depth of the original PC version, offering a satisfying mix of positioning, teamwork, and decision-making.

The variety of tanks â€” from nimble light vehicles to heavy armored beasts â€” allows every player to find a style that suits them. Progression feels rewarding, and the constant updates, events, and new tech trees keep the game fresh and engaging.

Controls are smooth and responsive, matchmaking is generally fair, and the 7v7 battles are perfectly tuned for mobile play without sacrificing intensity.

Overall, World of Tanks Blitz stands out as one of the best mobile action-strategy games, delivering both casual fun and competitive depth for players of all skill levels.

World of Tanks Blitz is genuinely a fun and addictive game. It has that special something that makes you want to play â€œjust one more match,â€ whether youâ€™re killing time or looking for a quick dose of action. But even though the game is good, there are several things that have been bothering many of us for a long time.

First, the prices of the in-game boxes are simply too high. A lot of players complain that they get almost nothing out of them, even after spending a serious amount of money. It feels terrible when you pay and the reward ends up being basically worthless. You go in hoping for a fair chance, but it ends up feeling like a lottery with no win.

Then there are the technical issues. Sometimes the ping spikes for no reason, FPS drops right when you need it the most, and the whole match is ruined. Not every battle is like that, but it happens often enough to be frustrating. Matchmaking can also put together teams that fall apart in a minute, leaving you with zero chance to make an impact no matter how hard you try.

Still, the game has huge potential. To make it better, I think the following things should be fixed as soon as possible: more stable ping, better FPS optimization, fairer and more predictable rewards, improved matchmaking, fewer pay-to-win elements, better team balance, more meaningful seasonal content, smoother progression without excessive grinding, better support for weaker devices, and of course more reasonable box prices. All of this would make a massive difference.
Thanks for reading. I hope 2026 turns out to be the year when Blitz shines again, and hopefully weâ€™ll finally see more realistic prices. Wishing everyone a peaceful and happy New Year!

Got about 5 times current hours on mobile and here's what I have to say on the current state of the game,

It is a decent game if you look foward to playing something like WoT but on a more fast paced, close quarters experience. But it is worht mentioning that this game lacks competitive balance and is often encouraging casual play more than skill-based or team based cooperation.

Be aware that big part of the thanks in the game are paid or use premium currency, not only that, but the current meta goes around premium/exclusive tanks which are not normally obtainable by the average player. It is also worth mentioning that the game includes gambling in the form of spin wheels and crates/lockboxes.

Even with all those cons, the game can be fun...

*IF you can spend a lot of time on it
*IF you're familiar with the core mechanics
*IF you previously had an account
*IF YOU DONT MIND LOSING CONSTANTLY
*IF you don't believe in the illusion of team work

(or if you have spare money I guess lol)

Positives:

(1) Game play is fun and engaging.
(2) Graphics and sound are nice.
(3) Plenty of variety (hundreds of different vehicles to choose from).
(4) Several different game modes, all of which are fun.
(5) Dozens of battle maps, each one unique.
(6) Plenty of players (matches are easy to find).
(7)  Game is free.

Negatives:

(1) Paying players can buy premium tanks, ammunition and boosters to give themselves an advantage.
(2) In-game chat can be very annoying (pointless rage baiting and cursing).
(3) Parts of the game are randomized (for example, your gun's aiming circle, which can produce frustrating misses).
(4) Many tanks are either fake or have been modified unrecognizably (although this will only be a problem if you are a tank enthusiast like me).
(5) Tanks are not well balenced (don't believe me, compare VK-30.01 D to M4A3E8)

Conclusion: Great game. Although it has some downsides, it is addictingly fun (I my-self have played 300+ hours)! Strongly recommend.
Is in a sense what classic WOT PC used to be. I don't really mind the aggressive adverts and store full of things to buy.

Poetic Review:  "A tank consists of millions of parts. The most important one is you."
The synergy between sapiens and its productions made from altered nature. And in all the history of human conflict, there have been no battles like Kursk. World of Tanks and World of Tanks Blitz focus on that particular man vs man by machine aspect and question the very idea of enhanced humans by machines. Tech trees improve, but something stays the same: the trail of self, the characteristic, the role of the tool shaped by sapiens.

Formal Review: World of Tanks Blitz is a fast, tactical tank shooter that rewards positioning, map awareness, situational teamplay, and mechanical discipline. The game offers a wide variety of nations and vehicles, each with distinct handling and battlefield roles, creating meaningful strategic depth in every match. Although balance changes and occasional matchmaking inconsistencies can be frustrating at times, the core gameplay loop remains deeply engaging. With additional alternative-physics modes, players can also experience more experimental and dynamic interactions. For those who enjoy precise movement, calculated engagements, unexpected synergies with teammates, and short but intense battles, Blitz stands out as one of the strongest action-tactical-strategy games available.

The game is simple and fun, but unfortunately it has a lot of problems. Itâ€™s basically a Pay-to-Win (or Pay-to-Fast) game. When you start developing a tank line and finally buy a new tank, you still have to research its parts â€” which can take days or even weeks to unlock, unless you pay real money to speed it up.

There are also Gold tanks, which are bought with real money and are absurdly strong. They earn way more credits than regular ones, while playing with normal tier 8â€“10 tanks costs tons of credits unless you have premium active â€” which, of course, is also paid.

What really made me quit was the fact that when I buy a tank, it comes incomplete. Itâ€™s like buying a Ferrari with a Ford engine â€” completely pointless.

I am very disappointed from combining multiple tank tiers in regular matches, an upgrade that was not there before, probably to increase commercialisation but it is not a good idea at all.

If you want to be constantly cheated in a variety of ways, welcome. Cheating happens everywhere. It happens in their "garage casinos" and during team balancing, where bots are allowed onto your team. There will be periods when you'll consistently have 2-3 bots with zero damage, leading to 8-10 losses in a row. The developers kindly call this "randomness," although in reality, it's a common scam to level the playing field. If you even slightly stand out from the crowd, be prepared for an influx of bots onto your team, be prepared for a lack of balance across tank classes, and, of course, expect misses and ricochets at point-blank range, from any angle, even where ricochets are physically impossible. But at the same time, everything will hit you; any tank at full speed will damage you without even aiming

While the game can be fun, out side of when you start off in the game you will be waiting 20-30 min for a lower tier (1-4) match even when there are more than enough people in the queue. So you are relegated to play whatever faction you started playing with. Unless you are willing to use gold to convert and use free xp. Server population also make it difficult to find matches often putting you in up tier matches where you are out gunned and often 1 shot killed by superior tanks. Out of 100 matches 76 were up tiered and 24 were either equal (15) or down tiered (9). Wargaming once concerned themselves with balanced play now it seem they are more interested in micro transactions that they offer as "Buy now or miss out forever" Sad to see a once good company fall victim to greed rather than enjoyment of their customers.

So if you are willing to wait for 30 minutes for a lower tier match just to get to play for target practice for a higher tier player this game is for you.
